name: UKCEH Countryside Survey Soil Health Webtool SOil funDamentals (SOD)
description:
The webtool allows comparison of the soil organic content, earthworm count, bulk density, and pH of your soil with soils with a similar land use, rainfall and general soil type within Great Britain.
Soil health: the user can compare the measured soil organic content, pH, bulk density, and earthworm concentration of a known soil with the range of values for those attributes for a full range of soils with a similar land use (e.g. agriculture and horticulture), rainfall, and soil type (e.g. light coarse texture soils) in Great Britain. The primary limitation of the tool is its geographic extent.
developers: Christopher Feeney, UK Centre for Ecology and Hydrology, UK; https://www.ceh.ac.uk/staff/chris-feeney
organizations: UK Centre for Ecology and Hydrology
minimum_req: Desktop computer (e.g. optimized for wider screens)
spatial_scales_other: The comparisons can only be made in Great Britain
output_data_formats: Static content (e.g. reports on website pages, tables and graphs in the tool's interface, PDF files)
access_barrier: No, direct download/access through a web link
access_procedure: Acceptance of the tool's terms and conditions
integrated_other_tools_list:
Land Cover Map 2020, UK Centre for Ecology & Hydrology (© UKCEH)

NATMAP vector, Cranfield University (Soils Data © Cranfield University)

National Soil Map of Scotland, Soil Survey of Scotland Staff, 1981 (© The James Hutton Institute, formerly Macaulay Institute for Soil Research, Aberdeen)

CHESS rainfall data 1961-2017: Robinson, E.L.; Blyth, E.M.; Clark, D.B.; Comyn-Platt, E.; Rudd, A.C. (2020). Climate hydrology and ecology research support system meteorology dataset for Great Britain (1961-2017) [CHESS-met]. NERC Environmental Information Data Centre. https://doi.org/10.5285/2ab15bf0-ad08-415c-ba64-831168be7293

Countryside Survey soils data: 1978, 1998, 2007 & 2019-2021 (© UKCEH)

Earthworm data from sources described in: Mason, K.E.; Ashwood, F.; Schmidt, O.; Cosby, J.; Keith, A.M. (2022). A compendium of earthworm data sources and associated information from the UK and Ireland, 1891-2021. NERC EDS Environmental Information Data Centre. https://doi.org/10.5285/1a1000a8-4e7e-4851-8784-94c7ba3e164f

feedback_tool_info: The tool deals with soil health.  Hence it does not deal with crop, livestock, trees, or people in the component section above.  I have entered the incorrect answer "Crop" simply so that I can submit the data for the tool.  This should be corrected.
